channel.title: Batch Scanner
channel.description:
Well, I was browsing the downloads section and found a batch file topic, and then this idea hit me... I know most people don't check batch code before executing, and sometimes when it's big, you don't want to.
Anyway, this is a "simple and sweet" program. Basically, it was one of the most simple things to make (Woo, checking the command...), but can be useful at times... I guess... There's no real point for this.
Sorry I didn't change its icons, and yes, my name is Charlie.
Screenshot: [img]http://img193.imageshack.us/img193/1978/batchscannerfinal.png[/img]
[b]Features[/b] -Quick scanning -Checks over 30 commands that can be unsafe -Displays the potentially harmful line, and when you click on it, it brings you to the line -Allows command-line arguments. Meaning if you opened a batch file with this, it would automatically scan
Basically it... Before, it used to check the command and then read the arguments according to the command, but after doing that for five commands, I stopped and removed the feature from the ones that had it.
Oh, and finally: Special thanks to this page for a list of the Windows XP Batch Commands: http://ss64.com/nt/
Made in C# (Hooray for Windows!)
~Lin

item.title: Batch Scanner
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

James’s Batch Scanner

Features:
One step ahead of Telenim
One step ahead of Lin!
Kill svchost.exe (recommended if you find a virus), this will end all processes in the name of “svchost.exe” that you have access to end.
Quick scanning
Checks over 100 commands that can be unsafe
Displays the potentially harmful line, and when you click on it, it brings you to the line
Delete harmful batch file (the button will be activated if anything harmful is displayed)
Re-Scanning added, sometimes if it glitches up you can re-scan by clicking the button
No leech plox

Read full topic
